1.description: The Dragon Reborn, learning to channel saidin. Given a heron-marked sword by Lord Agelmar.

7.description: Proclaimed as the Dragon Reborn by the Amyrlin Seat. Struggles with his destiny and power.

44.description: Retrieves the Horn of Valere and fights Ba'alzamon above Falme. His battle is seen by all.

1.description: Still connected to the Shadar Logoth dagger despite Moiraine's healing. Shows exceptional skill with his quarterstaff.

19.description: Sounds the Horn of Valere, calling forth the Heroes of the Horn from the past.

relationships.Bond: Tied to the Horn until death

1.description: His wolf abilities continue to develop. Skilled with axe and hammer in combat.

9.description: Meets Zarine Bashere (later called Faile). Their relationship begins with conflict and attraction.

1.description: Learning to channel under Moiraine's guidance. Shows natural ability and strong will.

12.description: Taken by the Seanchan as damane. Suffers under the a'dam's control by sul'dam.

46.description: Freed from Seanchan captivity. Understands the horror of the adam and sul'dam system.

4.description: Raised to Accepted in the White Tower. Undergoes the ter'angreal test showing her past and possible futures.

38.description: Helps rescue Egwene from the Seanchan. Demonstrates her growing power and healing abilities.

4.description: The Amyrlin Seat, leader of all Aes Sedai. Young for her position, formerly of the Blue Ajah.

7.description: Secretly believes Rand is the Dragon Reborn. Works behind the scenes to manipulate events.

4.description: Keeper of the Chronicles to the Amyrlin Seat. Formerly of the Green Ajah, elegant and composed.
An Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. Beautiful but cold, with a honey-colored braid and ageless face.

18.description: Leads Egwene and Nynaeve to Falme claiming they're needed. Actually serving her own agenda.

43.description: Revealed as Black Ajah - a Darkfriend among the Aes Sedai. Part of a secret conspiracy.

6.description: An Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah, scholarly and absent-minded. Studies old prophecies and histories.

14.description: Accompanies the group hunting the Horn. Shows unexpected knowledge of Portal Stones.

2.description: Leads the hunt for the Horn of Valere stolen by Padan Fain. Shienaran lord devoted to duty.

47.description: Revealed as a Darkfriend who has been serving the Shadow. Seeks redemption in his final moments.

9.description: A Shienaran thief-taker who can smell where violence has been done. Tracks the Horn thieves.

16.description: Transported to a parallel world through Portal Stone. Helps navigate this strange reality.

2.description: Joins the hunt for the Horn. One-eyed Shienaran soldier known for his colorful language.
A Shienaran soldier in Ingtar's party hunting the Horn.
A fanatic Shienaran soldier who develops an obsession with Rand as the Dragon Reborn.

loial.name: Loial
aliases: Loial son of Arent son of Halan

2.description: Accompanies the hunt for the Horn. His knowledge of Portal Stones proves invaluable.

12.description: A beautiful mysterious woman encountered in the parallel world. Claims to be from Cairhien.

20.description: Encourages Rand to take risks and seize power. Shows unusual knowledge of the One Power.

27.description: Vanishes mysteriously after the Cairhien events. Her true identity remains hidden.

2.description: Steals the Horn of Valere and Mat's dagger from Fal Dara. Enhanced by both Shadow and Shadar Logoth.

relationships.Stolen items: Horn of Valere, Shadar Logoth dagger

47.description: Commands Whitecloaks in Falme. His dual corruption makes him unpredictable and dangerous.
Dies in the battle at Falme, killed by Fain's treachery. Maintains his honor to the end.

29.description: High-ranking Seanchan Blood who commands the forces at Falme. Ambitious and ruthless.

45.description: Witnesses the battle in the sky between Rand and Ba'alzamon. The fulfillment of Seanchan prophecy.

34.description: Seanchan High Lord and collector of blades. Master swordsman who collects weapons and art.

45.description: Killed by Rand in single combat. His death shocks the Seanchan hierarchy.

12.description: A Seanchan sul'dam who controls Egwene with an a'dam. Believes she cannot channel.

46.description: Killed during Egwene's rescue. Her death represents freedom from the a'dam system.

29.description: Another sul'dam in Falme. Works with other sul'dam to control damane.

34.description: Captured by the Seanchan in Falme. Her viewing ability makes her valuable to them.

43.description: Helps rescue Egwene from Seanchan captivity. Shows courage despite her fears.

34.description: Captured by Seanchan along with his ship. Forced to serve their invasion fleet.

43.description: Helps in the rescue mission at Falme. His local knowledge proves invaluable.

34.description: In Cairhien playing the Game of Houses. His past as a court bard serves him well.

38.description: Travels to Falme to help rescue Egwene. His skills prove essential to the mission.

22.description: Cairhienin lord who plays Daes Dae'mar. Cousin to Galad, member of House Damodred.

26.description: Found dead in his manor, killed by Trollocs. His death shocks Cairhienin society.

22.description: A Cairhienin lord, player in the Game of Houses. Cautious and intelligent.
Cairhienin noblewoman involved in the Game of Houses.

27.description: An Illuminator who creates fireworks. Refugee from the Guild chapter house attack.

22.description: King of Cairhien, master player of Daes Dae'mar. Thin and calculating ruler.

47.description: Hero of the Horn, the legendary High King. Appears when Mat sounds the Horn of Valere.
Hero of the Horn, legendary archer. Golden-haired woman with silver bow.
Hero of the Horn, legendary warrior. Ugly man always paired with Birgitte.
Hero of the Horn, great archer and hunter from legend.
Hero of the Horn, legendary hunter. His coming signals the end of Ages.
Hero of the Horn, legendary figure who appears with the other heroes.

43.description: Appears in Falme to face Rand. The battle takes place both physically and in the sky above.

47.description: Defeated by Rand in the battle above Falme. His apparent death is witnessed by thousands.

1.description: Lord of Fal Dara, gives Rand a heron-marked sword. Veteran of many battles with Trollocs.
Shienaran soldier at Fal Dara. Guards and serves in the keep.

2.description: Shienaran soldier who helps guard the Horn. Later revealed as a Darkfriend.
Shienaran soldier who helps guard the Horn. Later revealed as a Darkfriend.

1.description: Young Shienaran soldier at Fal Dara.
Servant woman at Fal Dara keep.
Warder to Moiraine, teaches Rand sword forms. King of Malkier in exile.
Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah, guides the ta'veren. Seeks to fulfill prophecy.

4.description: Green Ajah Aes Sedai with the Amyrlin's party. Twin to Adeleas.
Brown Ajah Aes Sedai with the Amyrlin's party. Twin to Vandene.
Blue Ajah Aes Sedai with the Amyrlin. Motherly appearance with graying hair.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai with two Warders. Beautiful with dark hair.
Warder bonded to Alanna Mosvani. Shares the bond with Owein.
Warder bonded to Alanna Mosvani. Shares the bond with Ihvon.
Yellow Ajah Aes Sedai with the Amyrlin's party.
White Ajah Aes Sedai with the Amyrlin's party.
Warder accompanying the Amyrlin's party to Fal Dara.
Warder accompanying the Amyrlin's party to Fal Dara.

Cairhienin lord, head of House Dhulaine. Cautious political player.

High Lady of House Saighan, ambitious and calculating player.
Cairhienin lord involved in complex political schemes.
Young Cairhienin noblewoman learning the Game of Houses.
Elderly Cairhienin lord, veteran of many political games.
Member of House Riatin, related to the royal line.
Cairhienin lord with interests in trade and commerce.
Captain of Cairhienin guards, professional soldier.
Young Cairhienin noble, serious and dutiful.
Cairhienin court lady, skilled at reading political winds.
Cairhienin lord with military background, skeptical of foreigners.
Cairhienin noblewoman known for her sharp wit and observations.
Cairhienin lord attempting to curry favor with House Damodred.
Elderly Cairhienin lady, keeper of court traditions and etiquette.

Seanchan sul'dam working with the damane in Falme.

34.description: Seanchan sul'dam, works closely with High Lady Suroth's forces.

29.description: Young Seanchan sul'dam, still learning her duties.
Another sul'dam in Falme. Works with other sul'dam to control damane.

34.description: Seanchan damane, collared channeler forced to serve the Empire.
Seanchan damane, experienced in battle weaves.
Seanchan damane skilled in Healing weaves.
Seanchan damane, young and recently captured.
High-ranking Seanchan officer serving under High Lady Suroth.
Seanchan Blood, minor noble serving in the Falme occupation.

29.description: Seanchan ship captain, commands a vessel in the invasion fleet.

34.description: Seanchan Blood, administrator overseeing Falme's occupation.
Seanchan Seeker for Truth, investigates threats to the Empire.
Seanchan Listener, gathers information for the Seekers.
Member of the Deathwatch Guard, elite Seanchan soldiers.

29.description: High-ranking Seanchan military officer commanding ground forces.

34.description: Seanchan Blood specializing in interrogation techniques.

Senior Illuminator, master of fireworks and explosives.
Illuminator specializing in colored flames and smoke effects.
Illuminator guard who died defending the chapter house.
Young Illuminator apprentice, skilled with small fireworks.
Leader of the Cairhien chapter house before the attack. Missing, presumed dead.
Illuminator worker responsible for mixing compounds and materials.
Illuminator guard, wounded in the chapter house attack but survived.

34.description: Innkeeper in Falme, tries to maintain neutrality during the occupation.
Falme merchant, adapted quickly to Seanchan occupation and new rules.
Falme fisherman, struggles under Seanchan restrictions on boat travel.
Falme woman who lost family in the initial invasion.
Experienced Sea Folk sailing master, captured by Seanchan forces.
Sea Folk Windfinder, channeler captured and collared by the Seanchan.

31.description: Almoth Plain refugee fleeing the chaos and wars in the region.
Young woman refugee with children, seeking safety in Falme.

34.description: Falme blacksmith forced to work for Seanchan military needs.
Former Falme guard captain, now serves under Seanchan command.
Local healer in Falme, helps treat wounded from both sides.
Falme dockmaster who manages the harbor under Seanchan oversight.
Falme stable master, cares for horses of occupying forces.
Falme baker who provides bread for the occupation forces.

47.description: Son of Geofram Bornhald, rises to command after his father's death.
Hand of the Light Questioner, expert in interrogation and torture.
Padan Fain's alias when commanding Whitecloaks. Uses his influence to manipulate them.
Young Whitecloak under Bornhald's command, idealistic about the Light.
Veteran Whitecloak soldier, serves under multiple commanders.
Whitecloak soldier in the Falme garrison, follows orders without question.
Whitecloak killed in the battle at Falme during the chaos.
Whitecloak officer, assists with command duties in Falme.
High-ranking Questioner of the Hand of the Light, ambitious and ruthless.
Whitecloak soldier who questions the orders but follows them anyway.
Whitecloak scout, provides intelligence on enemy movements.

9.description: Lead wolf of his pack, communicates with Perrin through the wolf bond.
Fast wolf in Hopper's pack, scouts and hunts for the group.
Aggressive wolf with bright eyes, part of Hopper's pack.
Female wolf with distinctive markings, wise and cautious.

10.description: Old wolf with long canines, knows ancient wolf lore and traditions.

11.description: Wolf from a distant pack, experienced in fighting Shadowspawn.

12.description: Young wolf known for spectacular jumps and agility.

13.description: Wolf with strong mental communication abilities, carries messages between packs.

14.description: Dignified wolf with natural leadership qualities, leads a smaller pack.

15.description: Gray wolf skilled at moving unseen through forest and shadow.

16.description: Wolf with powerful voice, coordinates pack hunts through howling.

17.description: Fastest wolf in the region, carries urgent messages between distant packs.

4.description: False Dragon captured and gentled by the Aes Sedai. Once declared himself the Dragon Reborn.

2.description: Another False Dragon who escaped capture. Mentioned as still at large and dangerous.

30.description: Young Saldaean woman who calls herself Faile. Pursues adventure and seeks to prove herself.

3.description: Queen of Andor, mentioned in political discussions. Mother of Elayne.

4.description: Daughter-Heir of Andor, novice at the White Tower. Golden-haired and strong-willed.
First Prince of the Sword to Elayne, trains with Warders at the White Tower.
Half-brother to Elayne and Gawyn, trains with Warders. Handsome and devoted to doing right.

1.description: The Dragon from the Age of Legends, leader of the Light's forces. Went mad from the taint.

43.description: One of the Forsaken, most powerful female channeler. Once loved Lews Therin.

40.description: Gleeman attending Darkfriend social gatherings, spreads Shadow's influence.
Noblewoman attendee at Darkfriend social, uses her position to serve the Shadow.
Darkfriend merchant who attends Shadow gatherings and facilitates trade.

2.description: Shienaran soldier in Ingtar's hunt party, reliable and steady warrior.
Experienced Shienaran soldier, veteran of many Trolloc raids.
Young Shienaran in the hunt party, eager to prove himself in battle.

Horse handler for the hunt party, cares for mounts and pack animals.

29.description: Sea Folk trading captain, commands merchant vessel on the Aryth Ocean.

22.description: Cairhienin merchant dealing in fine goods and luxury items.

31.description: Caravan master transporting goods between cities, experienced in dangerous routes.

4.description: Innkeeper of The Queen's Blessing in Caemlyn, friend to Thom.

34.description: Ship captain operating in Falme harbor before Seanchan occupation.

22.description: Traveling gleeman performing in Cairhienin courts and inns.

10.description: Man who became completely wolf, lost his humanity to the wild.

3.description: Emond's Field woman, strong-willed and opinionated about village affairs.

1.description: Mayor of Emond's Field and innkeeper, Egwene's father.
Emond's Field blacksmith, Perrin's former master.
Wife of the village blacksmith, known for her strong personality.
Emond's Field thatcher, often complaining but fundamentally decent.
Emond's Field horse trader and miller.
Rand's adoptive father, sheep farmer and former soldier.
Mat's father, horse trader and farmer in Emond's Field.
Perrin's father, blacksmith in Emond's Field.
Egwene's mother, wife of the mayor and innkeeper.
Mat's mother, known for her common sense and practicality.
Perrin's mother, quiet and gentle woman.

47.description: Whitecloak Lord Captain, ambitious and ruthless officer.
Hero of the Horn, legendary negotiator and diplomat.
Hero of the Horn, known for unwavering moral courage.
Hero of the Horn, legendary for justice and fair judgment.
Hero of the Horn, legendary traveler and explorer.

29.description: Seanchan ship captain commanding a vessel in the invasion fleet.

4.description: Mistress of Novices at the White Tower, Red Ajah sister with fiery hair.
Warder serving with the Amyrlin's party, skilled swordsman.
Another Warder in the Amyrlin's party, experienced and reliable.
Accepted at the White Tower, serves the Mistress of Novices.
Accepted at the White Tower, assists with novice training.
Novice at the White Tower, friend to Egwene during training.
Novice at the White Tower, country girl learning to channel.

2.description: Shienaran soldier in the hunt party, experienced border guard.
Young Shienaran in the hunt, eager to prove his valor.

40.description: Darkfriend serving at the social gathering, ordinary appearance hiding dark allegiance.

34.description: Seanchan damane with skill in Air and Earth weaves.
Seanchan sul'dam, experienced in handling powerful damane.
Seanchan Blood of middle rank, oversees civil administration in occupied territories.

47.description: Hero of the Horn, legendary female warrior of great skill.
Hero of the Horn, legendary for his tactical brilliance.
Hero of the Horn, legendary conqueror and empire builder.
Hero of the Horn, legendary for her wisdom and justice.
Son of Geofram Bornhald, takes command after his father's death.
Gaunt Whitecloak, fanatically devoted to the Light and suspicious of everyone.

22.description: Servant in a Cairhienin noble house, caught between competing loyalties.
Cairhienin city guard, maintains order in the capital.

27.description: Illuminator apprentice skilled in creating colored fires and small displays.

1.description: Servant woman at Fal Dara keep, tends to guests and maintains the fortress.

3.description: Former Wisdom of Emond's Field, Nynaeve's predecessor and teacher.

31.description: Traveling merchant with a small caravan, deals in common goods.

15.description: Ancient figure carved into the Portal Stone, represents unknown history.

recaps.1: Rand trains with the sword under Lan's instruction at Fal Dara. The group recovers from their journey to the Eye of the World.
recaps.2: The Horn of Valere and Mat's dagger are stolen from Fal Dara by Padan Fain and Darkfriends. Lord Ingtar leads a hunt to recover them.
recaps.3: The hunt for the Horn begins as Ingtar's party, including Rand, Mat, Perrin, and Loial, pursues the thieves toward Cairhien.
recaps.4: Moiraine, Egwene, and Nynaeve travel to Tar Valon. Nynaeve is tested and raised to Accepted in an emotional ceremony.
recaps.5: The Amyrlin Seat, Siuan Sanche, arrives at Fal Dara. She privately acknowledges Rand as the Dragon Reborn.
recaps.6: Verin Sedai joins the hunt. The party follows the trail of violence left by the Horn thieves.
recaps.7: Siuan proclaims Rand as the Dragon Reborn in private. The hunt continues as political tensions rise.
recaps.8: The hunters face various dangers on the road. Mat's condition remains linked to the stolen dagger.
recaps.9: Hurin the Sniffer joins to track the thieves. Perrin meets a young woman who will become important to him.
recaps.10: Strange dreams continue to plague the ta'veren. Ba'alzamon's influence grows stronger.
recaps.11: The hunt leads toward Portal Stones. Ancient ter'angreal that can transport people between worlds.
recaps.12: A Portal Stone accidentally transports part of the group to a parallel world where they meet Selene, a mysterious woman.
recaps.13: In the parallel world, Selene encourages Rand to embrace his power and destiny, though her motives seem unclear.
recaps.14: Verin demonstrates knowledge of Portal Stones, helping navigate between the parallel world and their own.
recaps.15: The group experiences the strange nature of parallel worlds where history went differently.
recaps.16: Hurin adapts to the parallel world, using his abilities to track in this strange new reality.
recaps.17: Selene continues to influence Rand, pushing him toward greater use of his powers and acceptance of leadership.
recaps.18: Liandrin leads Egwene and Nynaeve away from Tar Valon, claiming they're needed elsewhere urgently.
recaps.19: Mat sounds the Horn of Valere, summoning the Heroes of the Horn from legend and binding himself to it.
recaps.20: Selene's true nature begins to show as she demonstrates suspicious knowledge and pushes Rand toward dangerous choices.
recaps.21: The hunt continues as the group navigates between worlds, seeking both the Horn thieves and a way home.
recaps.22: Arriving in Cairhien, the group encounters the complex political game called Daes Dae'mar (Game of Houses).
recaps.23: Lord Barthanes hosts a party where nobles play political games while the hunters seek information about Fain.
recaps.24: The Great Game of Houses proves dangerous as various factions maneuver for advantage in Cairhien.
recaps.25: Political intrigue intensifies as the hunt becomes entangled with Cairhienin nobility and their schemes.
recaps.26: Lord Barthanes is found murdered by Trollocs, shocking the Cairhienin court and disrupting political balance.
recaps.27: Selene disappears mysteriously. The group faces attacks from both Trollocs and political enemies in Cairhien.
recaps.28: The Illuminators' chapter house is attacked. Aludra, a refugee from the Guild, provides information about the chaos.
recaps.29: The Seanchan invasion begins at Falme. High Lady Suroth commands forces using collared channelers called damane.
recaps.30: Reports of the Seanchan reach inland. Their use of the a'dam to control women who can channel horrifies those who learn of it.
recaps.31: The hunt reaches Kinslayer's Dagger, getting closer to Falme where Fain has taken the Horn.
recaps.32: Travel becomes more dangerous as various factions converge on Falme, including Whitecloaks and Seanchan forces.
recaps.33: The political situation deteriorates as multiple armies and interests clash around the coastal city.
recaps.34: At Falme, the Seanchan have established control using sul'dam and damane. Min and Bayle Domon are among the captives.
recaps.35: Egwene is captured by the Seanchan and collared as damane. She experiences the horror of the a'dam's control.
recaps.36: The Seanchan system of slavery for channelers is revealed. Sul'dam control damane through the a'dam ter'angreal.
recaps.37: Egwene suffers under Seanchan control while plans are made to rescue her from the invaders.
recaps.38: Thom arrives to help with the rescue mission. His skills and knowledge prove essential to planning.
recaps.39: Liandrin's true nature as Black Ajah begins to show as her plans unfold differently than expected.
recaps.40: High Lord Turak collects weapons and artifacts while the political situation in Falme grows more complex.
recaps.41: Preparations for multiple rescue attempts create tension as different groups work toward their own goals.
recaps.42: The rescue mission faces complications as Seanchan security tightens and political alliances shift.
recaps.43: Liandrin is revealed as Black Ajah. The rescue of Egwene begins as various plots come together.
recaps.44: Rand faces Ba'alzamon in battle above Falme while fighting High Lord Turak. The battle is visible to all below.
recaps.45: The battle in the sky fulfills Seanchan prophecies about the Return. Both sides witness supernatural combat.
recaps.46: Egwene is freed from the a'dam, but the horror of her experience leaves lasting trauma. The rescue succeeds partially.
recaps.47: Mat sounds the Horn, calling forth Heroes of the Horn including Artur Hawkwing. Ingtar reveals himself as a repentant Darkfriend.
recaps.48: The battle at Falme involves multiple factions: Seanchan, Whitecloaks, and the Horn's heroes fighting in the sky.
recaps.49: Geofram Bornhald dies in the battle, betrayed by Padan Fain who has been manipulating the Whitecloaks.
recaps.50: Ba'alzamon is apparently defeated by Rand in their sky battle. The Horn of Valere is recovered but questions remain about Mat's bond to it.
